column1: Jack is in the kitchen in his house. Jack wants a cold drink from the refrigerator. The refrigerator is full of fresh food. Suddenly, a power cut changes the state of the food in the refrigerator to spoiled. Jack notices the power cut.
column2: Does Jack think the food in the refrigerator is fresh or spoiled?
column3: Jack thinks the food in the refrigerator is spoiled.
column4: Jack thinks the food in the refrigerator is fresh.

column1: Caden is in his new house. Caden wants to fix all the things that are not right. There is a big leak in the roof. Suddenly, the sun comes out and dries up the leak. Caden sees the sun dry up the leak.
column2: Does Caden think there is a leak in the roof or has the sun dried it up?
column3: Caden thinks the sun has dried up the leak.
column4: Caden thinks there is still a leak in the roof.

column1: Vivi is in her room playing with her toys. Vivi wants to lay her small, patient triangle toy on the shelf with her other toys. The triangle toy is in her toy box. Suddenly, her baby brother crawls into the room and takes the triangle toy. Vivi sees her baby brother take the triangle toy.
column2: Does Vivi believe the triangle toy is in her toy box or that her baby brother has taken it?
column3: Vivi believes her baby brother has taken the triangle toy.
column4: Vivi believes the triangle toy is in her toy box.

column1: Emma is in her room after a long day at school. Emma wants to draw on her white bathrobe to make it look creative. The bathrobe is plain and white. Suddenly, a spill from a bottle of bleach changes the bathrobe from white to a patchy white and yellow. Emma sees the bleach spill.
column2: Does Emma think the bathrobe is plain white or patchy white and yellow?
column3: Emma thinks the bathrobe is patchy white and yellow.
column4: Emma thinks the bathrobe is plain white.

column1: Ollie is at the beach building a sand castle. Ollie wants to dig a deep hole with his spade. The spade is sharp and safe to use. All of a sudden, a wave from the sea splashes on the spade making it slippery and dangerous. Ollie sees the wave splash on the spade.
column2: Does Ollie think the spade is safe or dangerous?
column3: Ollie thinks the spade is dangerous.
column4: Ollie thinks the spade is safe.

column1: Ben is at the train station. Ben wants to catch the train to go to work. The train is on time. Suddenly, a signal fault delays the train and makes it late. Ben sees the signal fault.
column2: Does Ben think the train is on time or late?
column3: Ben believes the train is late.
column4: Ben believes the train is on time.

column1: Pia is at her school library. Pia wants to read a mystery book. The mystery book is on the top shelf. Suddenly, a tall boy moves the mystery book to the bottom shelf. Pia sees the tall boy move the book.
column2: Does Pia think the mystery book is on the top shelf or the bottom shelf?
column3: Pia thinks the mystery book is on the bottom shelf.
column4: Pia thinks the mystery book is on the top shelf.

column1: Chloe is at a fair in her town. Chloe wants to hug the fireman at the fair. The fireman is very friendly. Suddenly, a loud noise scares the fireman and he becomes very scared. Chloe hears the loud noise.
column2: Does Chloe think the fireman is friendly or scared?
column3: Chloe thinks the fireman is scared.
column4: Chloe thinks the fireman is friendly.

column1: Wendy is at a yard sale in her town. Wendy wants to buy a beautiful bracelet she saw. The bracelet is shiny and cheap. Suddenly, a famous collector recognizes the bracelet and its value increases to an expensive price. Wendy hears the famous collector talking about the bracelet.
column2: Does Wendy think the bracelet is cheap or expensive?
column3: Wendy thinks the bracelet is expensive.
column4: Wendy thinks the bracelet is cheap.

column1: Yara is in her room with her favorite teddy bear, Stitch. Yara wants to hide Stitch so her little brother cannot find him. Stitch smells like yummy vanilla because Yara sprayed him with her vanilla perfume. Suddenly, a spilt bottle of vinegar changes the scent of Stitch to sour. Yara perceives the vinegar spill.
column2: Does Yara believe Stitch smells like yummy vanilla or sour vinegar?
column3: Yara believes Stitch smells like sour vinegar.
column4: Yara believes Stitch smells like yummy vanilla.

column1: Nia is in her home, ready to bake a cake. Nia wants to bake a cake in the oven. The oven is in good working order. Suddenly, a small earthquake shakes the house and the oven breaks. Nia realizes the oven is broken.
column2: Does Nia think the oven is in good working order or broken?
column3: Nia believes the oven is broken.
column4: Nia believes the oven is in good working order.

column1: Amy is walking in the park. Amy wants to sit on a bench and rest. The bench is covered with pretty vines. Suddenly, a gardener sprays the vines with a substance that changes them from non-harmful to harmful. Amy sees the gardener spraying the vines.
column2: Does Amy believe the bench is covered with non-harmful or harmful vines?
column3: Amy believes the bench is covered with harmful vines.
column4: Amy believes the bench is covered with non-harmful vines.

column1: Kate is in the park with her old toy car. Kate wants to drive the toy car on the clean cloth she brought. The cloth is clean and spread on the grass. Suddenly, a dog runs across the park and makes the cloth dirty with its muddy paws. Kate sees the dog spread mud across the cloth.
column2: Does Kate think the cloth is clean or dirty?
column3: Kate believes the cloth is dirty.
column4: Kate believes the cloth is clean.

column1: Ella is at the park with her parent. Ella wants to complete her ice cream before it melts. The ice cream has a sweet taste. Suddenly, a gust of wind blows some sand onto the ice cream, changing its taste to gritty. Ella notices that the sand got into her ice cream.
column2: Does Ella think her ice cream is sweet or gritty?
column3: Ella thinks her ice cream is gritty.
column4: Ella thinks her ice cream is sweet.

column1: Uma is in her room with a big clock on the wall. Uma wants to move the clock to another room. The clock is brown. Suddenly, a splash of paint from a passing parade changes the color of the clock to rainbow. Uma sees the splash of paint.
column2: Does Uma think the clock is brown or rainbow?
column3: Uma believes the clock is rainbow.
column4: Uma believes the clock is brown.

column1: Fred was at the park with his friends. Fred wanted to play a beautiful song on his trumpet for his friends. The trumpet was in his bag. Suddenly, a gust of wind blew the bag away, hiding the trumpet from sight. Fred saw the wind blow his bag away.
column2: Does Fred think his trumpet is in his bag or hidden from view?
column3: Fred believed his trumpet was hidden from view.
column4: Fred believed his trumpet was in his bag.

column1: Amy was in her room playing with her toy angel. Amy wanted to make the angel fly in the air. The angel's wings were open wide. Suddenly, a gust of wind struck and the angel's wings closed. Amy saw the gust of wind.
column2: Does Amy believe the angel's wings are open or closed?
column3: Amy believes the angel's wings are closed.
column4: Amy believes the angel's wings are open.

column1: Sally is in the garden in her house. Sally wants to plant flowers in the earth. The earth is dry and warm. Suddenly, a heavy rain cools the earth. Sally notices the rain.
column2: Does Sally think the earth is dry and warm or cool and wet?
column3: Sally believes the earth is cool and wet.
column4: Sally believes the earth is dry and warm.

column1: Lily Mae was at the market on a sunny Sunday. Lily Mae wanted to sell her strong perfume. The perfume had a sweet scent. Out of nowhere, a skunk sprayed near the market, changing the scent of the perfume to a bad one. Lily Mae smells the skunk's spray.
column2: Does Lily Mae think the perfume has a sweet scent or a bad one?
column3: Lily Mae thinks the perfume has a bad scent.
column4: Lily Mae thinks the perfume has a sweet scent.

column1: Dora is at the farm with her dad. Dora wants to ride the big, hairy horse. The horse is standing in the field. Suddenly, a loud noise from a passing truck scares the horse and it lies down on the grass. Dora hears the loud noise.
column2: Does Dora think the horse is standing or lying down in the field?
column3: Dora thinks the horse is lying down in the field.
column4: Dora thinks the horse is standing in the field.

column1: Ben was at the park playing with his dog. Ben wanted to make his dog's hair look nice by brushing it. The dog's hair was very safe to touch. Suddenly, a bee stung the dog making its hair dangerous to touch due to the dog's allergic reaction. Ben sees the bee sting his dog.
column2: Does Ben believe the dog's hair is safe or dangerous to touch?
column3: Ben believes the dog's hair is dangerous to touch.
column4: Ben believes the dog's hair is safe to touch.

column1: Lila was in an ancient city. Lila wanted to walk on the ancient road. The road was full of old stones. Suddenly, an earthquake shook the ground, causing the road to be destroyed. Lila felt the earthquake.
column2: Does Lila think the road is full of old stones or destroyed?
column3: Lila believes the road is destroyed.
column4: Lila believes the road is full of old stones.

column1: Quinn was at the park on a sunny day. Quinn wanted to unite his friends for a fun event. The picnic basket was full of food. Suddenly, a sneaky raccoon emptied the picnic basket while no one was looking. Quinn sees the sneaky raccoon.
column2: Does Quinn believe the picnic basket is full or empty?
column3: Quinn believes the picnic basket is empty.
column4: Quinn believes the picnic basket is full.

column1: Harry was at the park with his little red wagon. Harry wanted to ride his wagon down the big hill. The wagon was safe and sturdy. All of a sudden, a loose wheel made the wagon very dangerous. Harry saw the loose wheel.
column2: Does Harry think his wagon is safe or dangerous?
column3: Harry thinks his wagon is dangerous.
column4: Harry thinks his wagon is safe.

column1: Ollie was on a beach during the day. Ollie wanted to find a special shell hidden under the palm trees. The shells were hidden under the sand. Suddenly, a playful dog ran over and scattered the sand, making the shells visible. Ollie saw the dog scatter the sand.
column2: Does Ollie think the shells are hidden under the sand or visible on top of the sand?
column3: Ollie believes the shells are now visible on top of the sand.
column4: Ollie believes the shells are still hidden under the sand.

column1: Quinn was at the farm with all the animals. Quinn wanted to feed the goat. The goat was in the organized pen. Suddenly, a group of kids playing nearby left the gate open, allowing the goat to wander into a hot, sunny area. Quinn sees the kids playing and leaving the gate open.
column2: Does Quinn think the goat is in the organized pen or in the hot, sunny area?
column3: Quinn believes the goat is in the hot, sunny area.
column4: Quinn believes the goat is in the organized pen.

column1: Nia was in the attic of her old house. Nia wanted to find her old toy car in the attic. The toy car was thin and charged. Suddenly, a mouse chewed the wires of the toy car and it became discharged. Nia saw the mouse.
column2: Does Nia think the toy car is thin and charged or thin and discharged?
column3: Nia thinks the toy car is thin and discharged.
column4: Nia thinks the toy car is thin and charged.

column1: Yara was at a toy store. Yara wanted to buy a model car for her little brother. The model car was on the top shelf. Suddenly, an employee moved the model car to a lower shelf. Yara sees the employee move the model car.
column2: Does Yara believe the model car is on the top shelf or on a lower shelf?
column3: Yara believes the model car is on a lower shelf.
column4: Yara believes the model car is on the top shelf.

column1: Kim was in the park with her friends. Kim wanted to eat her pasta lunch. The pasta was in a plastic box. Suddenly, a stray football kicked by a child broke the plastic box. Kim sees the football hit her box.
column2: Does Kim think the pasta is in a broken or intact box?
column3: Kim thinks the pasta is in a broken box.
column4: Kim thinks the pasta is in an intact box.

column1: Ben was in his room playing with his toy robot. Ben wanted his robot to move and speak. The toy robot's battery was fully charged. Suddenly, the battery drained and became discharged. Ben saw the robot stop moving.
column2: Does Ben think the toy robot's battery is charged or discharged?
column3: Ben thinks the toy robot's battery is discharged.
column4: Ben thinks the toy robot's battery is charged.

column1: Carla was in a small, old church. Carla wanted to pray at the modest cross. The cross was in the open. Suddenly, a cat jumped on the ledge and knocked the cross, making it fall and close. Carla sees the cat jump on the ledge.
column2: Does Carla think the cross is open or closed?
column3: Carla thinks the cross is closed.
column4: Carla thinks the cross is open.

column1: Sam was at a big art show. Sam wanted to buy a creative painting. The painting had a low price. Suddenly, a famous artist praised the painting, which changed its price to very high. Sam hears the famous artist.
column2: Does Sam believe the painting is low priced or high priced?
column3: Sam believes the painting is high priced.

column1: Rita was at the park for a walk. Rita wanted to sit on a clean bench. The bench was clean and dry. Suddenly, a careless person spilled a drink on the bench, making it wet and sticky. Rita saw the person spill the drink.
column2: Does Rita believe the bench is clean and dry or wet and sticky?
column3: Rita believes the bench is wet and sticky.
column4: Rita believes the bench is clean and dry.

column1: Polly was at the bus stop. Polly wanted to start her journey to school. The bus was on time. Suddenly, the bus broke down and was off schedule. Polly saw the bus break down.
column2: Does Polly think the bus is on time or off schedule?
column3: Polly thinks the bus is off schedule.
column4: Polly thinks the bus is on time.

column1: Zoe was in her room with a big box of toys. Zoe wanted to sort her toys and put them in the box. The box was open. Suddenly, her little brother came in and closed the box. Zoe saw her brother close the box.
column2: Does Zoe think the box is open or closed?
column3: Zoe thinks the box is closed.

column1: Pete was at home, ready to sew a button on his shirt. Pete wanted to use a clean thread to sew the button. The thread was clean and ready to use. Suddenly, a candle flame nearby slightly burned the thread, making it smelly. Pete notices the candle flame.
column2: Does Pete think the thread is clean or smelly?
column3: Pete thinks the thread is smelly.
column4: Pete thinks the thread is clean.

column1: Rosa was in her room with her furry cat. Rosa wanted to play music and have her cat sit with her. The music player was fully charged. Suddenly, a power surge discharged the music player. Rosa notices the power surge.
column2: Does Rosa believe the music player is charged or discharged?
column3: Rosa believes the music player is discharged.

column1: Nia was in the garden picking vegetables. Nia wanted to pick some crunchy celery for her salad. The celery was clean and fresh. Suddenly, a mudslide covered the celery, making it dirty and mushy. Nia saw the mudslide.
column2: Does Nia think the celery is clean and crunchy or dirty and mushy?
column3: Nia thinks the celery is dirty and mushy.
column4: Nia thinks the celery is clean and crunchy.

column1: Vicky was in her room, feeling lonely. Vicky wanted to call her friend to chat. The phone had a lot of numbers. Out of nowhere, the phone got a new owner. Vicky saw the phone being taken away.
column2: Does Vicky believe the phone has a lot of numbers or a new owner?
column3: Vicky believes the phone has a new owner.
column4: Vicky believes the phone has a lot of numbers.

column1: Xander was in his garden, tending to his plants. Xander wanted to supply water to his plants. The earth in the garden was dry and thirsty. Suddenly, a playful dog ran across the garden, digging up the earth and changing its orientation. Xander sees the dog digging up the earth.
column2: Does Xander think the earth is dry and thirsty or dug up?
column3: Xander believes the earth is dug up.
column4: Xander believes the earth is dry and thirsty.

column1: Ivy was at a pet shop. Ivy wanted to buy a small cat with soft fur. She had enough money to buy the cat. Suddenly, the cat won a local pet show and its price went up to more than Ivy had. Ivy saw the pet show prize.
column2: Does Ivy believe the cat's fur is soft and shiny or does she think it's not?
column3: Ivy believes the cat's fur is soft and shiny.
column4: Ivy believes the cat's fur is soft and shiny.

column1: Mae was in her garden. Mae wanted to feed the birds with a worm. The worm was big and juicy. Suddenly, a hungry mole ate the worm, leaving no worm for the birds. Mae saw the mole eat the worm.

column3: Nellie believes the pizza is broken and scattered.

column1: Harry was in school, waiting for the quiz to start. Harry wanted to do well on the quiz. The quiz looked easy. Suddenly, the teacher announced that the quiz was actually very hard. Harry heard the teacher's announcement.
column2: Does Harry think the quiz is easy or hard?
column3: Harry thinks the quiz is hard.

column1: Iris was at a big game in the park. Iris wanted to find a lucky seat to watch the game. The seat was hard and uncomfortable. Suddenly, a spilled drink made the seat wet and sticky. Iris felt the wetness of the drink.

column1: Ella was at the park near the hospital. Ella wanted to eat her apple under the high tree. The apple was very fresh. Suddenly, a squirrel ran by and bit into the apple, making it not fresh anymore. Ella sees the squirrel.

column1: Yara was in the park with her friends. Yara wanted to create a strong mud castle. The mud was wet and easy to shape. Suddenly, the hot sun made the mud dry and hard. Yara feels the hot sun.

column3: Yara thinks the mud is dry and hard.

column2: Does Xander think his friend's voice is loud and clear or hard to hear?
column3: Xander thinks his friend's voice is hard to hear.
column4: Xander thinks his friend's voice is loud and clear.

column1: Rita was in her small village. Rita wanted the village to become more obedient and quiet. The village was peaceful and intact. Suddenly, a minor earthquake shook the village, changing it from intact to broken. Rita feels the earthquake.
column2: Does Rita think the village is intact or broken?
column3: Rita thinks the village is broken.
